required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacokinetic and Safety Study of Daclatasvir in Patients With Renal Impairment
clinical_study.official_title: Single Dose Pharmacokinetics and Safety of Daclatasvir in Subjects With Renal Function Impairment

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the effect of renal function impairment on the single dose pharmacokinetics of Daclatasvir.

detailed_description.textblock: Treatment, Parallel Assignment, Open Label, Non-Randomized, Single Dose Adaptive Design, Pharmacokinetics Study

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve From Time Zero Extrapolated to Infinite Time [AUC(INF)] of Daclatasvir
primary_outcome.description: AUC(INF) was estimated by summing the area under the plasma concentration-time curve from time zero to the time of the last quantifiable concentration and the extrapolated area, computed by the quotient of the last observable concentration and elimination rate constant. The pharmacokinetic (PK) analysis was based on Cockcroft-Gault (C-G) creatinine clearance (CLcr) grouping method: normal renal function, end stage renal disease (ESRD), moderate and severe renal impairment. Mild participants were counted as per their original allocation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Unbound Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve From Time Zero Extrapolated to Infinity Time (AUC(INF)u) of Daclatasvir
secondary_outcome.description: AUC(INF)u was calculated by multiplying the area under the plasma concentration-time curve from time zero extrapolated to infinite time by mean fraction of unbound drug from 1 hour post-dose time point.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of Daclatasvir
secondary_outcome.description: Maximum observed plasma concentration following drug administration from the raw plasma concentration-time data. The plasma samples were analyzed for daclatasvir by using a validated liquid chromatography tandem mass spectrometric (LC-MS/MS) assay.

secondary_outcome.measure: Unbound Maximum Observed Plasma Concentrations of Daclatasvir
secondary_outcome.description: Unbound Maximum observed plasma concentrations (Cmaxu) was calculated by multiplying maximum observed plasma concentrations by mean fraction of unbound drug from 1 hour post-dose time point.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve From Time Zero to Last Measurable Concentration [AUC(0-T)] of Daclatasvir
secondary_outcome.description: AUC(0-T) was calculated as the sum of linear trapezoids using non-compartmental analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Reach Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Tmax) of Daclatasvir
secondary_outcome.description: Tmax was defined as the time required to reach maximum observed plasma concentration. Tmax was directly determined from the raw plasma concentration-time data.
Terminal half-life was the time required for one half of the total amount of administered drug eliminated from the body.

secondary_outcome.measure: Apparent Total Body Clearance (CLT/F) of Daclatasvir
secondary_outcome.description: Apparent total body clearance was calculated by dividing the dose by area under the plasma concentration-time curve from time zero extrapolated to infinite time.
The CLU/F was calculated by dividing the apparent total body clearance by mean fraction of unbound drug from 1 hour post dose time point.

The percentage of daclatasvir recovered in the urine was determined by using validated liquid chromatography-tandem mass spectrometry methods. The sum of the percentage of dose recovered in urine from all intervals was calculated to obtain the total percentage of urinary excretion.
The CLR was calculated by dividing the total amount excreted in the urine from 0 to 96 hours by the area under the plasma concentration-time curve from time zero extrapolated to infinite time.

secondary_outcome.measure: Apparent Volume of Distribution (Vd/F) of Daclatasvir
secondary_outcome.description: The Vd/F was calculated by dividing the product of the dose and mean residence time by area under the plasma concentration-time curve from time zero extrapolated to infinite time.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Discontinuations Due to Adverse Events and Who Died
secondary_outcome.time_frame: First dose up to Day 5 post last dose for AEs; up to 30 days post last dose for SAEs
secondary_outcome.description: Adverse event (AE) was defined as any new unfavorable symptom, sign, or disease or worsening of a pre-existing condition that does not necessarily have a causal relationship with treatment. SAE was defined as a medical event that at any dose resulted in death, persistent or significant disability/incapacity, or drug dependency/abuse; was life-threatening, an important medical event, or a congenital anomaly/birth defect; or required or prolonged hospitalisation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Clinically Significant Laboratory Marked Abnormalities Reported as Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to Day 5 post dose
secondary_outcome.description: Significant laboratory abnormalities were defined as any test results which were observed beyond the clinically acceptable limits as per the discretion of investigator.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Clinically Relevant Changes in Electrocardiogram (ECG) Reported as Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to Day 5 post dose
secondary_outcome.description: The number of participants with clinically relevant changes in ECG which were considered as adverse events was determined.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Out-of-range Vital Signs Reported as Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to Day 5 post dose
secondary_outcome.description: The total number of participants with abnormal range vital signs which were considered as adverse events was determined.

arm_group.description: Daclatasvir 60 mg tablet by mouth single dose on Day 1

arm_group.arm_group_label: Group B (End Stage Renal Disease): Daclatasvir
arm_group.description: Daclatasvir 60 mg tablet by mouth single dose on Day 1
Daclatasvir 60 mg tablet by mouth single dose on Day 1
Daclatasvir 60 mg tablet by mouth single dose on Day 1

intervention.arm_group_label: Group B (End Stage Renal Disease): Daclatasvir

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Meet renal function criteria in one of four categories
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unstable or uncontrolled medical conditions

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The study was conducted at 2 centers in United States of America.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 58 participants were enrolled and 36 were treated with study drug. Remaining 22 were not treated (14 no longer met study criteria, 4 other reasons, 2 administrative reasons and 2 withdrew consent). Participants were grouped by Cockcroft-Gault creatine clearance method for primary analysis.

group.title: Normal Renal Function/Mild Renal Impairment
group.description: Participants with normal renal function and had creatinine clearance by the Cockcroft-Gault method >=90 milliliter per minute were administered with single oral dose of daclatasvir 60 mg tablet after 10 hours of overnight fasting on Day 1. One participant from this group, who had estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) 60-89 mL/min per 1.73 m^2, was reallocated into mild renal impairment reporting arm and was administered with a single oral dose of daclatasvir 60 mg tablet after 10 hours of overnight fasting on Day 1. Original allocation was based on an estimated eGFR, while the reallocation was based on the eGFR measurement at baseline.

group.title: Mild/Moderate Renal Impairment
group.description: Participants with moderate renal impairment and had eGFR 30-59 mL/min per 1.73 m^2 were administered with single oral dose of daclatasvir 60 mg tablet after 10 hours of overnight fasting on Day 1. Two participants from this group, who had eGFR 60-89 mL/min per 1.73 m^2, were reallocated into mild renal impairment reporting arm and were administered with a single oral dose of daclatasvir 60 mg tablet after 10 hours of overnight fasting on Day 1. Original allocation was based on an estimated eGFR, while the reallocation was based on the eGFR measurement at baseline.

group.title: Mild/Severe Renal Impairment
group.description: Participants with severe renal impairment and had eGFR 15 to 29 mL/min per 1.73 m^2 were administered with single oral dose of daclatasvir 60 mg tablet after 10 hours of overnight fasting on Day 1. One participant from this group, who had eGFR 60-89 mL/min per 1.73 m^2, was reallocated into mild renal impairment reporting arm and was administered with a single oral dose of daclatasvir 60 mg tablet after 10 hours of overnight fasting on Day 1. Original allocation was based on an estimated eGFR, while the reallocation was based on the eGFR measurement at baseline.

group.title: End Stage Renal Disease
group.description: Participants with end stage renal disease and had eGFR <15 mL/ min per 1.73 m^2, with or without hemodialysis were administered with single oral dose of daclatasvir 60 mg tablet after 10 hours of overnight fasting on Day 1.

group.title: Normal Renal Function/Mild Renal Impairment
group.description: Participants with normal renal function and had creatinine clearance by the Cockcroft-Gault method >=90 milliliter per minute were administered with single oral dose of daclatasvir 60 mg tablet after 10 hours of overnight fasting on Day 1. One participant from this group, who had eGFR 60-89 mL/min per 1.73 m^2, was reallocated into mild renal impairment reporting arm and was administered with a single oral dose of daclatasvir 60 mg tablet after 10 hours of overnight fasting on Day 1. Original allocation was based on an estimated eGFR, while the reallocation was based on the eGFR measurement at baseline.

group.title: End Stage Renal Disease
group.description: Participants with end stage renal disease and had eGFR <15 mL/ min per 1.73 m^2, with or without hemodialysis were administered with single oral dose of daclatasvir 60 mg tablet after 10 hours of overnight fasting on Day 1.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve From Time Zero Extrapolated to Infinite Time [AUC(INF)] of Daclatasvir
outcome.description: AUC(INF) was estimated by summing the area under the plasma concentration-time curve from time zero to the time of the last quantifiable concentration and the extrapolated area, computed by the quotient of the last observable concentration and elimination rate constant. The pharmacokinetic (PK) analysis was based on Cockcroft-Gault (C-G) creatinine clearance (CLcr) grouping method: normal renal function, end stage renal disease (ESRD), moderate and severe renal impairment. Mild participants were counted as per their original allocation.
outcome.population: PK data set included all participants who received at least 1 dose of daclatasvir with adequate PK profiles. The PK analysis was based on the C-G CLcr grouping method: normal renal function (n=11), ESRD (n=10), moderate (n=5) and severe renal impairment (n=6). Mild participants (n=4) are also counted as per their original allocation.

group.title: Normal Renal Function
group.description: Participants with normal renal function and had creatinine clearance by the Cockcroft-Gault method >= 90 milliliter per minute were administered with single oral dose of daclatasvir 60 mg tablet after 10 hours of overnight fasting on Day 1.

group.description: Participants with severe renal impairment and had eGFR 15 to 29 mL/min per 1.73 m^2 were administered with single oral dose of daclatasvir 60 mg tablet after 10 hours of overnight fasting on Day 1.

group.title: End Stage Renal Disease
group.description: Participants with end stage renal disease and had estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) <15 mL/ min per 1.73 m^2, with or without hemodialysis were administered with single oral dose of daclatasvir 60 mg tablet after 10 hours of overnight fasting on Day 1.

measure.title: Apparent Total Body Clearance (CLT/F) of Daclatasvir
measure.description: Apparent total body clearance was calculated by dividing the dose by area under the plasma concentration-time curve from time zero extrapolated to infinite time.
measure.population: Pharmacokinetic (PK) data set included all participants who received at least 1 dose of daclatasvir with adequate PK profiles. The PK analysis was based on C-G CLcr grouping method: normal renal function (n=11), ESRD (n=10), moderate (n=5) and severe renal impairment (n=6). Mild participants (n=4) are also counted as per their original allocation.

outcome.title: Unbound Apparent Clearance (CLU/F) of Daclatasvir
outcome.description: The CLU/F was calculated by dividing the apparent total body clearance by mean fraction of unbound drug from 1 hour post dose time point.
outcome.population: Pharmacokinetic (PK) data set included all participants who received at least 1 dose of daclatasvir with adequate PK profiles. The PK analysis was based on C-G CLcr grouping method: normal renal function (n=11), ESRD (n=10), moderate (n=5) and severe renal impairment (n=6). Mild participants (n=4) are also counted as per their original allocation.

group.title: Normal Renal Function
group.description: Participants with normal renal function and had creatinine clearance by the Cockcroft-Gault method >= 90 milliliter per minute were administered with single oral dose of daclatasvir 60 mg tablet after 10 hours of overnight fasting on Day 1.

group.title: Mild Renal Impairment
group.description: Participants were reallocated from other arms (normal, moderate and severe renal impairment) with mild renal impairment who had eGFR 60-89 mL/min per 1.73 m^2 were administered with single oral dose of daclatasvir 60 mg tablet after 10 hours of overnight fasting on Day 1.

group.title: Moderate Renal Impairment
group.description: Participants with moderate renal impairment and had eGFR 30-59 mL/min per 1.73 m^2 were administered with single oral dose of daclatasvir 60 mg tablet after 10 hours of overnight fasting on Day 1.

group.title: Severe Renal Impairment
group.description: Participants with severe renal impairment and had eGFR 15 to 29 mL/min per 1.73 m^2 were administered with single oral dose of daclatasvir 60 mg tablet after 10 hours of overnight fasting on Day 1.

group.title: End Stage Renal Disease
group.description: Participants with end stage renal disease and had estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) <15 mL/ min per 1.73 m^2, with or without hemodialysis were administered with single oral dose of daclatasvir 60 mg tablet after 10 hours of overnight fasting on Day 1.

measure.title: Unbound Apparent Clearance (CLU/F) of Daclatasvir
measure.description: The CLU/F was calculated by dividing the apparent total body clearance by mean fraction of unbound drug from 1 hour post dose time point.
measure.population: Pharmacokinetic (PK) data set included all participants who received at least 1 dose of daclatasvir with adequate PK profiles. The PK analysis was based on C-G CLcr grouping method: normal renal function (n=11), ESRD (n=10), moderate (n=5) and severe renal impairment (n=6). Mild participants (n=4) are also counted as per their original allocation.

outcome.title: Percent Urinary Recovery (%UR) of Daclatasvir
outcome.description: The percentage of daclatasvir recovered in the urine was determined by using validated liquid chromatography-tandem mass spectrometry methods. The sum of the percentage of dose recovered in urine from all intervals was calculated to obtain the total percentage of urinary excretion.
outcome.population: Pharmacokinetic (PK) data set included all participants who received at least 1 dose of daclatasvir with adequate PK profiles. The PK analysis was based on C-G CLcr grouping method: normal renal function (n=11), ESRD (n=3), moderate (n=5) and severe renal impairment (n=5). Mild participants (n=4) are also counted as per their original allocation.

group.title: Normal Renal Function
group.description: Participants with normal renal function and had creatinine clearance by the Cockcroft-Gault method >= 90 milliliter per minute were administered with single oral dose of daclatasvir 60 mg tablet after 10 hours of overnight fasting on Day 1.

group.title: Mild Renal Impairment
group.description: Participants were reallocated from other arms (normal, moderate and severe renal impairment) with mild renal impairment who had eGFR 60-89 mL/min per 1.73 m^2 were administered with single oral dose of daclatasvir 60 mg tablet after 10 hours of overnight fasting on Day 1.

group.title: End Stage Renal Disease
group.description: Participants with end stage renal disease and had estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) <15 mL/ min per 1.73 m^2, with or without hemodialysis were administered with single oral dose of daclatasvir 60 mg tablet after 10 hours of overnight fasting on Day 1.

measure.title: Percent Urinary Recovery (%UR) of Daclatasvir
measure.description: The percentage of daclatasvir recovered in the urine was determined by using validated liquid chromatography-tandem mass spectrometry methods. The sum of the percentage of dose recovered in urine from all intervals was calculated to obtain the total percentage of urinary excretion.
measure.population: Pharmacokinetic (PK) data set included all participants who received at least 1 dose of daclatasvir with adequate PK profiles. The PK analysis was based on C-G CLcr grouping method: normal renal function (n=11), ESRD (n=3), moderate (n=5) and severe renal impairment (n=5). Mild participants (n=4) are also counted as per their original allocation.

outcome.title: Renal Clearance (CLR) of Daclatasvir
outcome.description: The CLR was calculated by dividing the total amount excreted in the urine from 0 to 96 hours by the area under the plasma concentration-time curve from time zero extrapolated to infinite time.
outcome.population: Pharmacokinetic (PK) data set included all participants who received at least 1 dose of daclatasvir with adequate PK profiles. The PK analysis was based on C-G CLcr grouping method: normal renal function (n=11), ESRD (n=3), moderate (n=5) and severe renal impairment (n=5). Mild participants (n=4) are also counted as per their original allocation.

outcome.title: Apparent Volume of Distribution (Vd/F) of Daclatasvir
outcome.description: The Vd/F was calculated by dividing the product of the dose and mean residence time by area under the plasma concentration-time curve from time zero extrapolated to infinite time.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Discontinuations Due to Adverse Events and Who Died
outcome.description: Adverse event (AE) was defined as any new unfavorable symptom, sign, or disease or worsening of a pre-existing condition that does not necessarily have a causal relationship with treatment. SAE was defined as a medical event that at any dose resulted in death, persistent or significant disability/incapacity, or drug dependency/abuse; was life-threatening, an important medical event, or a congenital anomaly/birth defect; or required or prolonged hospitalisation.
outcome.time_frame: First dose up to Day 5 post last dose for AEs; up to 30 days post last dose for SAEs
outcome.population: Analysis was done in safety data set population, defined as all the participants who received the study medication.

group.title: Normal Renal Function/Mild Renal Impairment
group.description: Participants with normal renal function and had creatinine clearance by the Cockcroft-Gault method >=90 milliliter per minute were administered with single oral dose of daclatasvir 60 mg tablet after 10 hours of overnight fasting on Day 1. One participant from this group, who had eGFR 60-89 mL/min per 1.73 m^2, was reallocated into mild renal impairment reporting arm and was administered with a single oral dose of daclatasvir 60 mg tablet after 10 hours of overnight fasting on Day 1. Original allocation was based on an estimated eGFR, while the reallocation was based on the eGFR measurement at baseline.

group.title: Mild/Moderate Renal Impairment
group.description: Participants with moderate renal impairment and had eGFR 30-59 mL/min per 1.73 m^2 were administered with single oral dose of daclatasvir 60 mg tablet after 10 hours of overnight fasting on Day 1. Two participants from this group, who had eGFR 60-89 mL/min per 1.73 m^2, were reallocated into mild renal impairment reporting arm and were administered with a single oral dose of daclatasvir 60 mg tablet after 10 hours of overnight fasting on Day 1.Original allocation was based on an estimated eGFR, while the reallocation was based on the eGFR measurement at baseline.

Original allocation was based on an estimated eGFR, while the reallocation was based on the eGFR measurement at baseline.

group.title: End Stage Renal Disease
group.description: Participants with end stage renal disease and had eGFR <15 mL/ min per 1.73 m^2, with or without hemodialysis were administered with single oral dose of daclatasvir 60 mg tablet after 10 hours of overnight fasting on Day 1.

measure.population: Analysis was done in safety data set population, defined as all the participants who received the study medication.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Clinically Significant Laboratory Marked Abnormalities Reported as Adverse Events
outcome.description: Significant laboratory abnormalities were defined as any test results which were observed beyond the clinically acceptable limits as per the discretion of investigator.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co. agreements with investigators vary; constant is our right to embargo communications regarding trial results prior to public release for a period ≤60 days from submittal for review. We will not prohibit investigators from publishing, but will prohibit the disclosure of previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results, and request postponement of single-center publications until after disclosure of the clinical trial's primary publication.
